comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The picture shows the only built Cadillac Duoplane of 1929. Produced by the Cadillac Aircraft Company - Detroit / Michigan. The designer was H.G. McCarroll. Fourplace all-metal monoplane powered by 2 Kinner K-5 radials of 100 hp each. The serial is NX595E. Building such a machine in the Great Depression did not generate any sales.
